<!--
If it is a bug report:
- make sure you are able to repro it on the latest released version. 
You can install the latest version from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](../docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](../docs/KNOWNISSUES.md).
- Fill out the following repro template

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->
## Steps to reproduce

Forked the repo and had docker hub build the master branch. 

```
docker run --rm -it powershell
PS /> Invoke-WebRequest http://google.com
```
## Expected behavior

``` powershell

PS /> Invoke-WebRequest http://google.com
           Reading web response                                                            
StatusCode        : 200e stream...
```
## Actual behavior

``` powershell
λ docker run --rm  -it powershell
PowerShell
Copyright (C) 2016 Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

PS /> Invoke-WebRequest http://google.com
Invoke-WebRequest : The type initializer for 'System.Net.Http.CurlHandler' threw an
exception.
At line:1 char:1
+ Invoke-WebRequest http://google.com
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : NotSpecified: (:) [Invoke-WebRequest], TypeInitializa
   tionException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : System.TypeInitializationException,Microsoft.PowerShe
   ll.Commands.InvokeWebRequestCommand

```
## Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

``` powershell
PS /> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.0.0-alpha
PSEdition                      Core
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
BuildVersion                   3.0.0.0
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-alpha.9
CLRVersion
WSManStackVersion              3.0
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
```

This bug tracks the docker fix corresponding to #1937
# Fix

Docker file needs to install lib curl dependencies. 

```
apt-get update 
apt-get install libcurl3
```
title: Libcurl3 missing in docker dependencies
